section1.heading: 1. General Provisions
section1.paragraph1: These Privacy Terms apply when using the web platform operated by SotsiaalAI OĆ (hereinafter SotsiaalAI or the Platform). The policy explains how SotsiaalAI collects, uses and protects personal data in line with Estonian and EU law.
section1.paragraph2: SotsiaalAI processes personal data in accordance with the Estonian Personal Data Protection Act and the EU General Data Protection Regulation.

section2.heading: 2. Data We Collect
section2.paragraph1: 2.1 Account data. Email address, role (specialist or client), and authentication method (email + PIN). Name and personal ID are not collected or stored.
section2.paragraph2: 2.2 Subscription and payment data. Subscription type and status, payment ID. Payments are processed by Maksekeskus AS; SotsiaalAI does not store card or bank account details.
section2.paragraph3: 2.3 Technical metadata. IP address, browser type, device information and logs for security and troubleshooting purposes.

section3.heading: 3. Purposes and Legal Bases
section3.items:
• Service delivery (providing conversations, account access) - performance of a contract (GDPR Art. 6(1)(b)).
  • Payment processing - performance of a contract and legitimate interest to prevent fraud (Art. 6(1)(b),(f)).
  • Security, error detection and reliability - legitimate interest (Art. 6(1)(f)).
  • Legal claims and reporting - legal obligation/legitimate interest (Art. 6(1)(c),(f)).

section4.heading: 4. Conversation Privacy
section4.body: Conversation content is not stored permanently or used for marketing or analytics. Technical processing of conversations may take place via an authorised service provider (e.g. answer generation).

section5.heading: 5. Processors
section5.body: SotsiaalAI may use processors who handle data under SotsiaalAI's instructions, including the payment service provider (Maksekeskus AS) and the AI service provider. Contracts are in place with processors to ensure the level of data protection and confidentiality.

section6.heading: 6. Data Disclosure and Sharing
section6.body: Personal data is not shared with third parties unless required to provide the service, mandated by law or based on user consent. Payment data is processed by Maksekeskus AS under its own terms.

section7.heading: 7. Retention
section7.body: Account data is retained until the account is deleted or upon user request. Billing data is retained as required by accounting laws. Technical logs are stored for a short time for security and troubleshooting purposes.

section8.heading: 8. Your Rights
section8.items:
• Right to access your data and obtain a copy.
  • Right to rectify inaccurate or incomplete data.
  • Right to request erasure ("right to be forgotten").
  • Right to restrict processing or object to it.
  • Right to lodge a complaint with the Data Protection Inspectorate.

section9.heading: 9. Cookies
section9.body: We only use essential cookies (login, session, language preference). No advertising, tracking or analytics cookies are used.

section10.heading: 10. Security
section10.body: We implement technical and organisational measures (HTTPS, access controls, logging and backups) to protect data against unauthorised access, alteration or destruction.

section11.heading: 11. Changes
section11.body: This privacy policy may be updated. Significant changes will be communicated within the product or via email.

section1.heading: 1. General Provisions
section1.body: These Terms of Use govern the use of the SotsiaalAI platform (operator: SotsiaalAI OĆ; hereinafter the Platform). By using the Platform you confirm that you have read these Terms and agree with them.

section2.heading: 2. Service Description
section2.body: The platform provides AI-powered information support in the social sector. Responses are generated based on the SotsiaalAI knowledge base hosted in Estonia, which brings together reliable sources (for example laws, guidelines, service descriptions and other sector-specific information).

section3.heading: 3. Account and Access
section3.items:
• Keep your account secure and your PIN private.
  • Do not share your account or login credentials with third parties.
  • Keep your contact and payment details up to date.

section4.heading: 4. Permitted Use
section4.items:
• It is prohibited to breach security, distribute malware or send mass requests.
  • It is prohibited to transmit unlawful content or violate the rights of others.

section5.heading: 5. Subscription, Payments and Cancellation
section5.paragraph1: The service is provided on a monthly subscription basis (monthly fee ā‚¬7.99). Payments are processed by Maksekeskus AS via the payment method selected by the user.
section5.paragraph2: The subscription can be managed at any time on the profile page (ā€Manage subscriptionā€¯) or by emailing info@sotsiaal.ai. When cancelled, billing stops from the next billing period.
section5.paragraph3: SotsiaalAI may change pricing and subscription terms by publishing the information on the Platform and notifying active subscribers with reasonable prior notice.

section6.heading: 6. Availability and Maintenance
section6.body: We make reasonable efforts to ensure reliability and continuous availability. Maintenance and updates may temporarily limit the service, but we aim to keep interruptions as short as possible.

section7.heading: 7. Reliability and Accuracy
section7.body: SotsiaalAI aims to provide accurate and up-to-date information. If an error or inaccuracy occurs, we will correct it as soon as possible.

section8.heading: 8. Changes to the Terms
section8.body: The Terms of Use may be updated by publishing a new version on the platform. Users will be informed of significant changes via email or in-product notifications.

section9.heading: 9. Use of AI and Data Processing
section9.paragraph1: SotsiaalAI uses language technology developed by OpenAI (GPT model) to generate answers in the language provided by the user, relying on the SotsiaalAI knowledge base hosted in Estonia.
section9.paragraph2: The OpenAI service is used exclusively for text processing. Conversation content is not used for model training or improvement, and data stored permanently (user account, subscription and conversation summaries) is kept securely on servers operated by SotsiaalAI in Estonia.

section10.heading: 10. Intellectual Property
section10.body:
The Platformā€™s trademarks, design, software, technical solution and other content (except for user-submitted data and public source materials) belong to SotsiaalAI OĆ or its partners.

You may use the Platform and its outputs only for personal purposes or for performing your work duties within a reasonable scope. Without SotsiaalAIā€™s written consent, it is prohibited to systematically copy, distribute or use the Platform or its outputs in a way that exceeds normal use or infringes intellectual property rights.

section11.heading: 11. Termination
section11.body:
You may stop using the Platform at any time, including by deleting your account or cancelling your subscription in accordance with these Terms.

SotsiaalAI may suspend or terminate your access to the Platform if you materially breach the Terms, abuse the service, or jeopardise the Platformā€™s security.

section12.heading: 12. Governing Law and Dispute Resolution
section12.body:
These Terms are governed by the laws of the Republic of Estonia.

Disputes will first be attempted to be resolved by negotiation. If no agreement is reached, the dispute will be resolved by the courts of the Republic of Estonia in accordance with applicable law.

intro.paragraph1: SotsiaalAI is an AI-powered platform designed to provide reliable and easy-to-understand support for both social-sector professionals and people seeking help with everyday social questions.
intro.paragraph2: The platform offers two role-based AI assistants: one for professionals and one for people reaching out with personal matters. Both are built to deliver needs-based assistanceā€”whether it concerns legislation, benefits, services, or work-related situations. The answers draw on trusted sources, simplified explanations, and practical guidance.
intro.paragraph3: The social sector is characterised by heavy workloads, fragmented information, and a complex system landscapeā€”something also confirmed by the OSKA report (2025). Our aim is to bring clarity, simplify daily work, and support both professionals and people seeking help.
intro.paragraph4: The platform is developed and operated by SotsiaalAI OĆ. We are a social enterprise whose goal is not to maximise profit, but to solve a societal challenge and create positive impact. Social entrepreneurship combines business activity with a social mission: we generate revenue, but reinvest it into improving the service, expanding access, and strengthening the social sector.
intro.paragraph5: We continuously enhance the service to ensure a timely and practical experience for everyone.

cta.title: Before using the site, make sure to review:

guide.title: How to use the platform?
guide.intro: This guide walks you through the real SotsiaalAI flow: choosing a role, creating an account, activating a subscription, signing in, using the chat assistant and adjusting language or accessibility preferences.

accessibility.title: 1. Language and accessibility
accessibility.body:
On your first visit the "Language and accessibility" window opens so you can decide how SotsiaalAI should look and behave. You can open the same window later on the "Profile" page.

  • Language. Choose the interface language: Estonian, Russian or English.
  • Text size. Pick the size that is easiest to read (small, standard, large or extra large).
  • Contrast. Enable high contrast whenever you need clearer buttons and text.
  • Animations. Select "Reduce motion" if movement distracts you or if your computer or internet connection is slower.

home.title: 2. Home page
home.body:
The home page shows two role cards ā€” "For social work professionals" and "For people seeking help" ā€” plus the "ABOUT" link at the top, which opens the background page.

  • If you are not signed in, clicking a card opens the sign-in/registration view.
  • If you are signed in, the platform checks that you have an active subscription and then opens the chat for the selected role.

register.title: 3. Registration and subscription activation
register.body:
You need an account and an active subscription to talk to the assistant.

Registration

  • Pick the relevant role card and click "Register".
  • Fill in the form (email address and PIN).
  • Choose your role (specialist / person seeking help). The role determines which features and assistant you use.
  • Accept the terms of use and privacy policy.
  • Submit the form ā€“ we sign you in automatically and redirect you to the subscription view.

Subscription

  • After confirmation you are redirected to the subscription page.
  • Select a plan, review the monthly price and conditions, and confirm the payment.
  • Once the payment succeeds, access to the chat assistant becomes active.

signin.title: 4. Sign-in and navigation by role
signin.body:
Returning users also start on the home page.

  • Click the role card to open the sign-in dialog.
  • Log in with Smart-ID, Mobile-ID, Google or email + PIN.
  • If you forgot the PIN, use the "Forgot PIN" link.
  • With an active subscription you are sent to the chat page; otherwise you will see instructions to activate or renew the subscription.

chat.title: 5. Chat page
chat.body:
The chat is available only when the account has an active subscription.

  • Type your question in the message field at the bottom and send it with the button or Enter.
  • The "Conversations" button in the top-left opens your earlier chats.
  • The profile icon in the top-right takes you to the "Profile" page.
  • Each answer includes a Sources button so you can review the referenced documents and links.

profile.title: 6. Profile
profile.body:
The "Profile" page combines your account, subscription and accessibility settings.

  • See the user role.
  • Subscription view: review the plan, monthly price and validity.
  • View and update the email address.
  • Update the PIN.
  • Change language, text size, contrast and the amount of animation.

about.title: 7. ABOUT
about.body:
On the "ABOUT" page you will find:

  • a short explanation of who SotsiaalAI is for;
  • contact information;
  • links to the terms of use and privacy policy;
  • a link to the "Platform guide" (this page).

quickstart.title: 8. Quick start
quickstart.body:
1. Open sotsiaal.ai and choose the preferred language/accessibility settings.
  2. Select the role card that matches you: specialist or person seeking help.
  3. Register ā€“ the account is ready immediately and you are redirected to the subscription page.
  4. Complete the subscription on the subscription page.
  5. Sign in; with an active subscription the chat page opens.
  6. Ask your questions, manage earlier chats via "Conversations" and adjust preferences on the "Profile" page.
